Phoenix/Skyblaze::

The pair seperate, and Skyblaze takes hold of Phoenix's hands.  Both 
forms melt away into an energy globe like Skyblaze had first appeared 
as.  The globe leaves the same way it got in, except it flies into 
the mountains instead of back into space.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> 
> : : Wolfenstein : :
> Wolfenstein: Well, i guess she has decided. You should take her. 
Good bye, Phoenix.
>  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> 
wrote:Phoenix/Skyblaze::
> 
> Skyblaze looks down at his long-lost daughter.  "That depends on 
> where she wants to go."
> 
> Phoenix glances shyly at the other bots in the room, then back at 
> Skyblaze.  "Just ... away from here, for now.  Away from all the 
> fighting, and carnage, and death ..."  The femme buries herself a 
> little farther in her father's arms.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > 
> > : : Razor/Wolfenstein : :
> > Sense Wolfenstein seemed to be calling the shots in this 
situation, 
> Razor looked over at him. Wolf made eye contact, that said to make 
no 
> hostile actions.
> > Wolf then looked back at the reformed family.
> > Wolfenstein: Will you be taking Phoenix now?
> > The preceding has been paid for by the
> > New World Order
> >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> 
> wrote:Phoenix/Skyblaze::
> > 
> > Phoenix accepts the hand up and looks at Skyblaze.  The elder 
male 
> > meets her gaze and the pair of them stand there for just a 
moment, 
> > looking at each other.  Then Skyblaze walks over and gently takes 
> > Phoenix in his arms.  With the tenderness one would show a young 
> > child, he traces his finger along the charred lines of the nWo 
> brand 
> > on her chestplate.  As he touches the damaged areas, they glow 
and 
> > heal as if she'd never been touched by the torch.
> > 
> > "Bless you, child," he says to her, quietly.  "I was beginning to 
> > think I'd never find you."
> > 
> > In the back of Phoenix's mind, memories stir.  Her link to the 
> > collective mind of her people restores itself, and she finally 
> > rediscovers her true identity.  "Father ..." she whispers, and 
the 
> > two of them hug each other tightly, parent and child reunited at 
> last.
> > 
> > OOC: Awwww ... okay, so it's a bit mushy.  A LOT mushy.  Yadda, 
> > yadda, put away the hankies and respond.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Hollywood Narrator" 
> > <hollywood.narrator@v...> wrote:
> > > The second pod had cracked open near the nWo's base. Something 
> > sprang from it all at once and ran towards the nWo base. The form 
> > skidded to a halt, thinking the base may have defenses. It waits 
> for 
> > the robots who live here to notice and allow it entry. That is, 
if 
> > they decided not to hack it to pieces instead. The odd creature a 
> > large black wasp, which had unusually RAN at extreme speeds 
towards 
> > the base rather than flying.
> > > 
> > > Inside the base, though, Deemos, perhaps the only bot who 
didn't 
> > draw a weapon, was too busy looking at this new intruder to be 
> > searching for new bots outside or performing computer scans, and 
> > computers weren't Arrow or Spider's styles...
> > > 
> > >   ----- Original Message -----
> > >   From: Richard Allen
> > >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

> > > 
> > > 
> > >   : : Razor/Diesel/Heartbreak/Wolfenstein : : 
> > > 
> > >   HBK and Diesel prime their weapons for battle. 
> > > 
> > >   Razor was about to adress this Skyblaze when Wolf cut in. 
> > > 
> > >   Wolfenstein: Yes we do. I'm sure you speak of Phoenix. She is 
> > here. 
> > > 
> > >   Wolf reaches out his hand to help Phoenix up, to show her to 
> > Skyblaze. 
> > > 
> > >   The preceding has been paid for by the 
> > >
